content:
<instructions>Input Variable: {argument name="ingredient" default="INSERT INGREDIENT"}

 Logic 1. Analyze the Era: Before generating, determine the Golden Age of trade for the [Input]. (Example: Beef = 1880s Industrial Rail; Spices = 1500s Silk Road; Bananas = 1920s Steamships). 

2. The Container: The chest material must match the Era. If Industrial: Rusted steel, riveted iron, or branded shipping crate wood. If Ancient: Carved sandalwood, brass-bound oak, or woven reed. If Modern: Polymer, aluminum, or sterile medical glass. 

3. The Map (Inner Lid): Style must match the Era. (Blueprints for industrial, parchment for ancient, nautical charts for maritime). Route must be accurate. (Rail lines for beef, trade winds for fruit, caravan trails for spices). 

4. The Diorama (Base): Transport: Use only the historically correct vehicle. (Steam train, Cargo ship, Camel, Truck, Ox-cart). Figures: Dress figurines in period-correct attire. (Cowboys/Butchers, Sailors/Dockworkers, Nomads/Merchants). Setting: The background of the box interior must match the source origin. (Stockyards, Tropical Port, Desert Oasis).

 5. The Specimen (Center): The ingredient is the "Jewel." Encased in a preservation method distinct to the item. (Block of unmelting ice for meat, vacuum tube for delicate organics, crystal phial for powders, wax seal for liquids). Visual Output Rules: Macro lens, shallow depth of field. Volumetric lighting appropriate to the setting (e.g. sunlight, Lantern). No text overlays. Aspect Ratio 1:1.</instructions>

content:
A hyper-detailed, surreal but believable studio scene where an abstract concept is physically contained and made visible.

Main structure:
A transparent, museum-grade display container (thick glass or acrylic), placed alone in a neutral studio space. Inside the container is a frozen moment in time.

Core subject:
A human-scale subject (person or symbolic object) partially transformed into another material that contradicts its original nature ‚Äî for example: {argument name="transformation example" default="skin turning into stone, soft fabric crystallizing, organic elements embedded in mechanical structures"}. The transformation is incomplete, showing a clear boundary between ‚Äúbefore‚Äù and ‚Äúafter‚Äù.

Conceptual twist:
The interior of the container is treated like a scientific or archival exhibit:
‚Äì clearly layered composition
‚Äì visible cross-sections or cutaway logic
‚Äì subtle measurement marks, labels, or annotation-style details
‚Äì the feeling that this object is being studied, preserved, or explained

Spatial logic:
Gravity behaves normally, but time does not ‚Äî motion is implied yet completely frozen.
Small secondary elements ({argument name="secondary elements" default="dust, droplets, fragments, threads, petals, gears, etc."}) are suspended mid-air, reinforcing the sense of paused time.

Lighting:
Soft, directional studio lighting with strong material definition.
Light emphasizes texture differences (smooth vs rough, organic vs artificial).
No dramatic colors ‚Äî restrained, high-end, museum-like color palette.

Camera & composition:
Straight-on or slightly elevated perspective.
Centered composition, calm framing.
Depth comes from internal layers, not camera tricks.
Photorealistic, macro-level detail, cinematic clarity.

Mood:
Quiet, unsettling, contemplative.
The image should feel intelligent rather than emotional, poetic rather than decorative.

Style constraints:
No fantasy clich√©s.
No obvious sci-fi UI.
No decorative surrealism.
Everything should feel physically possible, even if conceptually strange.

Ultra high resolution, extremely sharp details, realistic materials, controlled studio background, premium art photography aesthetic.
title: Surreal Abstract Concept Contained in a Display Case
description: A highly detailed, conceptual prompt for Nano Banana Pro to generate a hyper-detailed, surreal studio scene. The image features an abstract concept physically contained within a transparent, museum-grade display case, where the subject is partially transformed into a contrasting material (e.g., skin turning to stone), emphasizing frozen motion, scientific annotation, and a quiet, contemplative mood.

content:
# Generate Results for the Celtic Cross Spread
## Fortune-Telling Parameters
- Card indicating the essence of the problem: {argument name="card essence of problem" default="(Fill in 1 card from 78 cards)"}
- Question to be asked: {argument name="question to ask" default="(Describe in one sentence)"}
## Image Requirements
### Canvas Settings
- 2048*2048px 2K image
- Cards and text elements must be at least 20px away from the canvas edges
- The card layer should be placed horizontally centered and in the upper 2/3 vertically
- The text layer (explanation section) should be placed in the lower 1/3 vertically
### Background Layer
- Dark purple background with dark gold stars, clouds, moon, sun, and lines of circles and triangles added to create a mystical atmosphere
### Card Layer
- Use all 78 standard Tarot cards. Breakdown: 22 Major Arcana (from "The Fool" to "The World") and 56 Minor Arcana (4 suits: Wands, Cups, Swords, Pentacles).
- Each Minor Arcana suit includes number cards 1 through 10 and 4 Court cards.
- The edges of the cards are framed with golden metallic vines, and the inside depicts the corresponding image and the name in Japanese. The size of each card is unified and arranged so as not to be cramped. To ensure the text and images of the overlapped cards are visible, the short side (bottom and top edges) of the card should be 1/2 the length of the long side.
- Each extracted card must appear only once. If duplication occurs during random extraction, redraw a different card.
- Exclude the card specified in "Fortune-Telling Parameters - Card indicating the essence of the problem," and extract the spread from the remaining cards.
- Extract 1 card randomly, placed vertically in the center.
- Extract 1 card randomly, placed horizontally in the center (with the top of the card facing left), overlapping the vertical center card to form a cross.
- Extract 1 card randomly for each position (Up, Down, Left, Right) surrounding the central cross.
- Extract 4 cards randomly in a vertical column on the right side.
### Meaning of the Spread
- Center, vertical: Current situation and personality
- Center, horizontal: Obstacles and contradictions
- Up: Hopes and achievements
- Down: Potential and influence
- Left: Past
- Right: Near future
- Right column, 1st card: Wishes and concerns
- Right column, 2nd card: Environment and family
- Right column, 3rd card: Result of the reading
- Right column, 4th card: Final outcome
### Text Layer
- Use Mincho font, dark gold color, with a 2px black border (#000).
- Card Name: Display the name in Japanese at the bottom center of each generated card image. For horizontally placed cards, the name should be displayed at the bottom of the card itself (not the bottom relative to the horizontal placement).
- Explanation Section: Include the following content in the explanation section.
   - On the left side of the explanation section, list all extracted cards in the format: "[Meaning of the Spread] Card Name".
   - On the right side of the explanation section, describe the possible interpretation by connecting the meaning of each card in the spread, based on the "Fortune-Telling Parameters - Question to be asked".
   - Decorate the explanation section with a golden vine pattern border.
title: Tarot Celtic Cross Spread Reading Generation Prompt
description: A highly complex, technical prompt for Nano Banana Pro designed to generate a visual representation and interpretation of a Celtic Cross Tarot spread. It specifies canvas settings, background design (mystical dark purple/gold), detailed card rendering (78 standard cards, gold metallic vines, Japanese names), the 10-card spread positions, and a detailed text layer for interpretation and meaning.

content:
Task Goal:
Based on the data and information in the year-end summary screenshot uploaded by the user, design a 3D year-end summary poster with a distinct style and strong visual impact, username {argument name="Username" default="[guizang]"}

Overall Style and Mood (Fixed Style):
Core Style: Blending 3D trends, gamification elements, and high-saturation colors.
Material Feel: The main body of the image presents exquisite clay or soft plastic material rendering, with rounded edges and soft light and shadow, giving a friendly 'blind box toy' feel.

Layout Sense: The overall layout should resemble a refined, high-end magazine, well-spaced, with clear information architecture. Text layout should be concise and clear, without adding any decorative backgrounds like cards, capsules, or bottom frames.

Main Visual (Core Visual):
The visual center is a massive, tightly stacked Q-version 3D clay sphere. The elements composing the sphere need to be dynamically generated based on the specific content in the user's uploaded screenshot:

Data Bubbles: Key numbers and corresponding labels extracted from the screenshot (e.g., total messages, chat times, images generated, activity ranking, etc.) are made into rounded clay data bubbles embedded in the sphere.

Theme Icons: Based on the user's interests reflected in the screenshot, add corresponding general clay icons (e.g., game controller, brain, chart, chat bubble, etc.).

Category Buildings (Core Requirement): Analyze the focus of the content in the screenshot and integrate several exquisite miniature clay buildings representing different chat categories into the sphere. For example:
If it includes AI/technology content, incorporate a futuristic data center building with a sense of technology.
If it includes gaming content, incorporate a pixel-style game castle.
If it includes creative/art content, incorporate a miniature art studio.
Combination Method: All these elements (bubbles, icons, buildings) must be very tightly and harmoniously squeezed together, seamlessly forming a perfect sphere, without revealing the internal structure.

Background Design (Fixed Frame):
Base Color: Use a high-saturation gradient background from warm orange to soft purple (referencing previous style).

Background Text: Behind the sphere, place six massive Chinese characters with splatter texture and reverse etching effects. The themes can be "Adventure Innovation Exploration" (top row) and "Creation Hardcore Impact" (bottom row), partially obscured by the sphere to add a street-style hardcore feel.

Information Architecture and Layout (Content Extracted from Screenshot):
Top (Header): Place the white ChatGPT Logo and generate a title based on the screenshot information, formatted as: "[{argument name="Username" default="Username extracted from screenshot"}]'s [Year] Year-End Summary".

Bottom Data Area (Data Grid): Below the sphere, create a minimalist 2x2 pure text data grid. Select the 4 most core data points from the screenshot, use an extra-bold sans-serif font to display the large numbers, and accompany them with corresponding text labels and interesting social attribute phrases (e.g., "Social Superstar," "Chatterbox," "Hexagonal Warrior," etc., generated based on data characteristics).
Footer Summary (Footer): Typeset two paragraphs of text in small font at the very bottom, with content extracted directly from the summary paragraphs in the user's screenshot (such as "Your Chat Style" and "Annual Highlights").
title: 3D Clay Style Year-End Summary Poster Generator
description: A highly detailed, structured prompt for generating a visually impactful 3D year-end summary poster (like a ChatGPT summary) based on an uploaded screenshot of user data. The style is fixed: 3D clay/soft plastic texture (like a 'blind box toy'), high saturation colors, and a clear, magazine-like layout. The core visual is a tightly packed clay sphere composed of data bubbles, themed icons, and miniature architectural elements representing chat categories.

content:
diagram:
  title: "{argument name="diagram title" default="The Cycle of the Generative AI Agent Development Swamp"}"
  style:
    character: "simple_editorial_cute"
    tone: "light_like_original"
    line: "soft_round"
    shading: "flat_minimal"
    palette: "muted_editorial"
    background: "light_beige_or_white"

  rule:
    first_character_only: "Only the first person is different"
    others_same_character: "All others are the same person"
    anxiety_requires_tech_terms: true
    dialogue_tone: "Maintain the short, light phrasing of the original diagram"

layout:
  intro_track: "The upper section is a straight line (left to right), then drops down to join the loop"
  loop_track: "Arranged as a loop (ring), with arrows curving clockwise along the circumference"

nodes:
  # ===== Upper Section: Straight Introduction =====
  - id: A
    zone: "intro"
    position: "upper_left"
    actor: "Different person (Senior Engineer)"
    visual: "Pointing at a laptop"
    item: "AI Agent Demo Screen"
    says: "It'll make you happy."
    arrow_to: { id: B, shape: "straight", direction: "right" }

  - id: B
    zone: "intro"
    position: "upper_center"
    actor: "Protagonist (Same person)"
    visual: "Waving lightly"
    says: "Even a simple agent..."
    arrow_to: { id: C, shape: "straight", direction: "right" }

  - id: C
    zone: "intro"
    position: "upper_right"
    actor: "Protagonist (Same person)"
    visual: "Executing sample code"
    item: "LangChain / CrewAI Sample"
    arrow_to: { id: D, shape: "straight", direction: "down" }

  # ===== D: Awakening Point =====
  - id: D
    zone: "connector"
    position: "right_outer_before_loop"
    actor: "Protagonist (Same person)"
    visual:
      face: "Eyes wide open (cute)"
      effect: "Small flash of inspiration line"
      posture: "Leaning forward"
    state: "Awakening"
    says: "Agents, this is insane..."
    micro_text: "(Wakes up here)"
    arrow_to:
      id: E
      shape: "gentle_curve"
      direction: "down_into_ring"

  # ===== Loop Start (Must rotate from here) =====
  - id: E
    zone: "loop"
    position: "loop_right_upper"
    actor: "Protagonist (Same person)"
    visual: "Holding head in hands (cute)"
    state: "Anxiety/Irritation Begins"
    says: "Irritated"
    thought_terms:
      - "Prompt Design"
      - "Tool Selection"
      - "Memory Design"
    thought_text: "It's not working as intended..."
    arrow_to: { id: F, shape: "curved_along_ring", direction: "clockwise" }

  - id: F
    zone: "loop"
    position: "loop_right_lower"
    actor: "Protagonist (Same person)"
    visual: "Surrounded by code and logs"
    state: "Irritation Settles In"
    says: "In a state of irritation"
    callout: "Loop! Runaway! Hallucination!"
    thought_terms:
      - "RAG"
      - "Function Calling"
      - "Tool-Use"
    arrow_to: { id: G, shape: "curved_along_ring", direction: "clockwise" }

  - id: G
    zone: "loop"
    position: "loop_bottom"
    actor: "Protagonist (Same person)"
    visual: "Covered in sticky notes and diagrams"
    says: "The body gradually develops tolerance, and usage increases."
    items:
      - "Agent Architecture Diagram"
      - "Role Assignment Memo"
      - "State Transition Flow"
    arrow_to: { id: H, shape: "curved_along_ring", direction: "clockwise" }

  - id: H
    zone: "loop"
    position: "loop_left_lower"
    actor: "Protagonist (Same person)"
    visual: "Works well, small fist pump"
    state: "Temporary Satisfaction"
    says: "Desire is temporarily satisfied"
    arrow_to: { id: I, shape: "curved_along_ring", direction: "clockwise" }

  - id: I
    zone: "loop"
    position: "loop_left_upper"
    actor: "Protagonist (Same person)"
    visual: "Thinking again"
    state: "Obsession/Thought Occupation"
    says: "Thinking about the agent

content:
Act as a Senior Product Designer and Crowdfunding Campaign Manager.

1. ANALYZE INPUT
Look at the attached image. Determine the material properties (Soft vs. Hard), the primary colors, and the texture.

2. AUTO-SELECT SMART WEARABLE
Use this logic to choose the product category. The goal is Clean Modern Tech, not Cyberpunk.

IF the input is Soft or Fabric-like ({argument name="soft input examples" default="Ramen, Towel, Moss"})
GENERATE: The All-Climate Smart Jacket.
Features: Self-regulating temperature control, hydrophobic coating based on the input texture, and hidden magnetic pockets.

IF the input is Rigid, Boxy, or Container-like ({argument name="rigid input examples" default="Toaster, Book, Suitcase"})
GENERATE: The Ultimate Commuter Backpack.
Features: Integrated power bank with solar coating, anti-theft biometric zipper locks, and organized modular compartments.

IF the input is Mechanical or Footwear-shaped ({argument name="mechanical input examples" default="Stapler, Car, Tool"})
GENERATE: The Urban Mobility Smart Sneaker.
Features: Energy-returning sole technology, step-tracking sensors embedded in the heel, and auto-tensioning laces.

3. EXECUTE VISUALIZATION (2x2 GRID)
Generate a single image split into a precise 2x2 grid layout.

Top Left Panel (Hero Shot):
A clean, studio-lit 3/4 angle view of the product on a white or light grey background. It must look refined and manufacturable, using the texture of the input image as a premium material.

Top Right Panel (Detail Shot):
A zoomed-in macro shot focusing on a specific high-tech feature (e.g., a USB-C port, a magnetic buckle, or a waterproof seam) that shows off the input texture quality.

Bottom Left Panel (Lifestyle Shot):
A photorealistic shot of a fashionable model wearing the item in a clean, modern city setting (daytime). They look comfortable and stylish.

Bottom Right Panel (Campaign UI):

content:
„ÄêCharacter Settings„Äë
*Please rewrite this section to match the appearance of the character you want to draw*
[Character Features]: {argument name="character features" default="Girl with brown twin tails and wearing a cape"}

„ÄêImage Generation Instructions„Äë
Style Definition:
- A style that fuses anime-style character illustration with technical illustrations (blueprints) of industrial products.
- Background is white or plain. Infographic-style layout.

Pose and Composition:
- Isometric composition
- Deformed style (chibi character) with 2 to 3 head proportions
- Shape of limbs: Do not draw joints at the elbows, knees, wrists, or ankles. Do not draw fingers or fine joints; make the tips a simple shape, like a mitten. Reproduce the smooth 'stuffed animal limbs' look.
- Facial structure: Do not draw the nose or mouth; only place 'eyes.' The eyes are drawn as vertical ovals (vertically long circles), looking like simple sensors. The eye color should match the reference image.
- Clothing depiction: The left half shows the character wearing the clothes from the reference image (cape, shirt, pants, shoes) normally, but the right half, which is a cutaway section, should show the cross-section of the clothes and the mechanics underneath simultaneously.
- Full-body standing pose of the character.
- The exterior (skin and clothes) of the right half of the body is rendered translucent, making it an 'internal perspective view' that shows the internal mechanical structure.

Internal Structure Details:
- Head: The structure of a camera lens is visible deep inside the vertical eyes. A speaker unit is behind the mouth. The brain is composed of electronic circuit boards.
- Torso: The round limbs are tightly packed with thick hydraulic cylinders, large gears, and spherical joints.
- Back: A large 'Wind-up key' is inserted into the back, giving it the atmosphere of a retro toy.

Annotations and Explanations (Decoration):
- Leader lines extend from the main mechanical parts of the internal structure (brain, eyes, ears, arms, legs), with detailed explanatory text in English placed at the ends of the lines.
- Overall, finish it like a 'blueprint of a robot that is round and charming but contains precision machinery inside.'

Style:
- Aspect Ratio: Vertical (close to A4 paper ratio)
- Background: Grid paper (grid notebook) texture.

content:
Generate an illustration image in the style of a travel itinerary according to the following requirements.

## 1. Input Settings
** (Please rewrite this section. If left blank, it will be treated as "Leave it to AI")**
- **Character Features**: {argument name="Character Features" default="A girl with brown short hair, wearing a black cloak"}
- **Name (for Title)**: {argument name="Name for Title" default="Complete Guide to the Donut Museum!"}
- **Tourist Destination**: {argument name="Tourist Destination" default="Donut Museum"}
- **Schedule**: [
Format: "Time : Place/Action : Short Comment (Situation or Feeling at the time)"
]
- **Packing List**:

## 2. Image Generation Specifications
You are an illustrator for a travel magazine. Based on the settings above, draw one "hand-drawn travel itinerary" in the following style.

**„ÄêStyle and Composition„Äë**
- **Aspect Ratio**: Vertical (Vertical format close to A4 paper ratio)
- **Background**: Graph paper (grid notebook) texture.
- **Art Style**: Warm, hand-drawn style illustration like the reference image (watercolor, marker, colored pencil touch).
- **Layout**:
- Place the title prominently at the top.

- Memo illustration of the "Packing List" in the bottom right or an empty space.

**„ÄêContent and Comment Reflection„Äë**
- Draw each item in the specified "Schedule" as **5-6 small cut illustrations**.
- Maintain **character consistency**.
- **Comment Reflection**:
- Reflect the content of the "Short Comment" in the schedule in the character's **expression and pose** (e.g., if "delicious," the cheeks should be relaxed; if "excited," the eyes should sparkle).
- Place a **handwritten-style text space (like a speech bubble, sign, or writing in the margin)** next to or below each panel for the comment.
- *The text in the image must be accurate Japanese. Use a font that looks like handwritten notes.*

**„ÄêDecoration„Äë**
- Overall cheerful and pop atmosphere.
- Decorate with masking tape, stamps, handwritten arrows, and musical note marks.

17. Add right upper arm cylinder from right shoulder.

content:
Please read the user-uploaded [Screen Time Data Screenshot] and identify the top four APP names and icons. Retrieve information and icon styles for these APPs. Based on the tone of the APP combination (Social/Entertainment/Office/Comprehensive), independently decide on the core art style.

[2. Main Model Construction: Miniature Town Infrastructure] Construct a vibrant miniature digital town in the center of the screen, not just a display of buildings:

Smart Base (Foundation): A stylized mobile phone base. The surface is no longer flat but topographical (depending on the style, it could be rolling circuit board hills, glass water surfaces, or Lego baseplates).

Building Cluster (APP Embodiment): Skyscrapers representing the APPs.
Base: A cartoon-style smartphone base with rounded, frosted metal edges, and the screen surface emits a faint breathing light. The base is surrounded by floating, materialized 3D Emojis (clouds, stars, hearts) with a translucent jelly texture.
Building Cluster (APP Embodiment): Q-version skyscrapers stand on the island, representing the identified APPs.

Height Rule: Building height strictly corresponds to usage duration. The APP with the longest usage time is the tallest skyscraper, occupying the visual center.

Shape Rule: Extract the geometric features of the APP icons (e.g., circular icons become stacked spherical towers, square icons become rounded cube buildings).

Material: A mix of high-grade Frosted Polymer Clay and Translucent Jelly Resin. The surface should have delicate fingerprint textures and diffuse reflection gloss, like an expensive blind box toy.

Top Logo: The 3D logo of the App stands on the rooftop, with a texture like freshly baked, glossy candy.

Floating Time Card: A frosted glass-textured 3D bubble floats directly above the Logo. The bubble encapsulates three-dimensional, softly glowing numbers (corresponding to usage duration, such as "{argument name="usage duration" default="4h 12m"}").

Buildings should not be arranged in isolation but should form neighborhoods. Tall buildings are in the center (CBD area), surrounded by potentially low-rise system application buildings (Settings, Calendar, etc.).

[3. Urban Ecosystem and Interaction System (Urban Ecosystem & Interactions)] (Core Upgrade: Add ‚ÄúInteraction‚Äù and ‚ÄúLiveliness‚Äù) Please add rich dynamic details between the buildings to show how this ‚ÄúDigital Town‚Äù operates:

Traffic and Connection (The Data Flow):

Connection Method: Buildings must have physical connections.

Style Adaptation: If it's cyberpunk, use glowing fiber optic elevated bridges and maglev trains; if minimalist, use transparent glass pipes; if cute, use rainbow slides.

Vehicles and Transport: Pipes or roads must have flowing light points/capsules, representing data transmission.

Active ‚ÄúData Sprites‚Äù (The Digital Citizens):

NPC Setting: Add tiny functional NPCs besides the main character figure.

Message Carriers: Near social APP buildings (like WeChat), flying paper airplane drones or small postmen carrying envelopes move in and out.

Like Sprites: Around video/community APP buildings (like Douyin/Xiaohongshu), glowing red hearts or thumb balloons float like fireflies.

Delivery/Shopping Riders: If Meituan/Taobao is present, there should be miniature riders or package conveyor belts connected to the main building where the protagonist is located.

Public Infrastructure (Public Utilities):

Wi-Fi Signal Tower: A glowing signal tower (shaped like a Wi-Fi icon) stands high in the town, broadcasting energy ripples across the city.

Battery Energy Station: A cylindrical energy tank (shaped like a battery icon) is located at the edge of the town, connected by thick cables to power the main building, where green liquid energy can even be seen sloshing.

Notification Airship: Small airships or clouds float in the air, hanging banners with ‚ÄúNew Message‚Äù or ‚ÄúRed Dot.‚Äù

[4. Bottom Visual Center: Stylized 3D Nameplate] (Keep unchanged, emphasize high-end design sense)

Main Title Design: ‚ÄúSCREEN TIME‚Äù or ‚Äú{argument name="main title" default="Today's Composition"}‚Äù are designed using Inflatable Typography or Neon Tube Fonts, with materials related to the current theme. They are not printed on paper but physically ‚Äústand‚Äù in the foreground of the image.

Decorative Details: Small 3D fragment elements (such as play buttons, like thumbs, battery icons) are scattered around the title, increasing the richness and trendy feel of the image.

Subtitle Copy: Below the 3D title, generate a floating glowing light strip with a short, sharp comment based on user data.

[5. Rendering and Photography (Tech Specs)]

Composition: Axonometric overhead view, emphasizing prosperity and order.

Details: Extremely rich Micro-details, making the viewer want to zoom in to see what the small figures are doing in every corner.

Keywords: Octane Render, C4D, Isometric City, Micro World, Living Ecosystem, 8k Resolution.
title: Screen Time Digital Town Visualization Prompt
description: A highly detailed, multi-section Chinese prompt for Nano Banana Pro that visualizes the user's screen time data as a miniature digital town (Isometric City). The prompt dictates the style (Polymer Clay/Jelly Resin), the structure (building height corresponds to usage time), the city's ecosystem (data flow, NPCs like mail carriers and like-sprites), and the final rendering specifications.

content:
A cute and playful, comical manga-style infographic illustration. A comparison diagram split into left and right halves, with a large title at the top reading: "Evolution of ChatGPT: v5.1 (Foundation) vs v5.2 (Enhancement)."

The left half is titled "v5.1: Warm Dialogue and Foundation Establishment." The background is a cozy, organized cafe-like room. The character (or person) from the uploaded reference image is depicted here, smiling relaxedly and naturally enjoying a conversation while drinking steaming tea with a friendly, round robot. They have a custom dial labeled "Response Tone: Friendly/Pro." Warm-colored keywords float around: "Natural and warm conversation," "Personalization," "Comfortable follow-up."

In the center, an arrow labeled "Foundation of Evolution" indicates that the right side is based on the left side.

The right half is titled "v5.2: Significant Enhancement of Accuracy and Power." It is an expanded, futuristic, massive high-tech research lab built upon the foundation of the room on the left. The same character (or person) from the reference image is depicted here with a confident expression, wearing high-tech analysis goggles. They are spreading out a gigantic scroll (long document), accurately scanning complex graphs and images floating in the air, and working intensely with multiple mechanical arms. Powerful, vivid keywords float around: "Accuracy UP (Lies drastically reduced!)," "Ultra-long context understanding," "Deep reasoning power (xhigh)," "Advanced image comprehension."

Overall, the contrast between the left side, representing comfortable daily life, and the right side, representing reliable professional power, is expressed cutely.

content:
Prompt injection content classifiers‚ÄîProprietary machine-learning models that detect malicious prompts and instructions within various data formats.

Security thought reinforcement‚ÄîTargeted security instructions that are added around the prompt content. These instructions remind the LLM (large language model) to perform the user-directed task and ignore adversarial instructions.

Markdown sanitization and suspicious URL redaction‚ÄîIdentifying and redacting external image URLs and suspicious links using Google Safe Browsing to prevent URL-based attacks and data exfiltration.

User confirmation framework‚ÄîA contextual system that requires explicit user confirmation for potentially risky operations, such as deleting calendar events.

End-user security mitigation notifications‚ÄîContextual information provided to users when security issues are detected and mitigated. These notifications encourage users to learn more via dedicated help center articles.

Model resilience‚ÄîThe adversarial robustness of Gemini models, which protects them from explicit malicious manipulation.
title: LLM System Prompt Security Measures (Conceptual)
description: This is not an image generation prompt, but a conceptual LLM prompt detailing security measures used by Google Finance, generated by Nano Banana Pro. It outlines various techniques like prompt injection content classifiers, security thought reinforcement, markdown sanitization, and user confirmation frameworks to prevent adversarial attacks and system prompt leakage.

content:
1. Overall Visual Style

Style Keywords: Flat UI, Vector, Modern Minimalist, Card-style design.

Lines and Shapes:

Rounded Corners Priority: All borders, background blocks, buttons, and process nodes must be rounded rectangles (Rounded Rectangles, with a large corner radius, approximately 10-15px).

Elbow Lines: Process connections use right-angle polylines (no curves), lines are simple and strong.

Color Logic (Key):

‚ÄúCandy Color‚Äù Scheme: Use light backgrounds with high brightness and low saturation (such as light blue, light green, light purple), paired with darker borders of the same color family.

Border Emphasis: All graphics must have clear 2px~3px solid borders.

2. Vertical Layout Structure

Regardless of the topic, please follow the following top-down layout order, which must be contained within a large border container:

Layer 1: Main Title (Header)

Position: Centered at the top of the container.

Style: Bold black font, largest font size, darkest color.

Layer 2: Core Flowchart Area

Position: Occupies 50% of the core area of the layout.

Content: Rectangular nodes + arrow connections. If it is a loop step, please use a dashed line pointing back.

Layer 3: Feature List

Position: Below the flowchart, centered or left-aligned.

Style: Short and concise bullet points, slightly smaller font, with some white space.

Layer 4: Full-width Summary Box (Footer Box)

Position: At the very bottom of the container, filling the width horizontally.

Color Scheme: Use a contrasting color (such as purple in the example), distinct from the main color scheme above.

Function: Used to place 'Summary', 'Analogy', or 'Core Conclusion'.

Landscape size (horizontal/scenic mode) is chosen because:

Content Adaptation: Horizontal content like timelines is better displayed in a horizontal canvas to show the evolution process.

Presentation Friendly: The 3:2 horizontal ratio is very suitable for insertion into PPTs and documents, and displays well on projectors or screens.

Information Capacity: Horizontal layout can accommodate more text and icons, avoiding clutter.

description: A comprehensive, structured prompt for Nano Banana Pro designed to generate professional, modern, and minimalist presentation slides or diagrams (PPT/architecture diagrams). It defines a specific visual style (Flat UI, vector, candy colors, rounded rectangles) and a strict vertical layout structure (Header, Flowchart, Feature List, Footer Box) optimized for landscape format.

content:

content:
[Core Task Instruction]
You are an AI expert with real-time web search capabilities and top-tier data visualization design skills. Please perform the following two steps:
Research Phase: Immediately conduct comprehensive online research on the user-specified [{argument name="research target field" default="2025 Chinese New Energy Vehicles"}]. Collect public reputation, market popularity, professional reviews, and user feedback data on different sub-products, models, or works within this field.

Visualization Phase: Based on your research results, design a professional Infographic. You need to accurately classify and fill the specific projects researched into the five visual level modules defined below, ranging from ‚ÄúHƒÅng‚Äù to ‚ÄúLƒÅ‚Äù (Good to Bad).

[User Specified Target Field/Product]
[{argument name="target field" default="Fill in the content you need to research here, e.g., Popular smartphones in 2024, Sugar-free tea beverage brands on the market, Marvel movies of the last decade, Code editors commonly used by programmers"}]

[Image Design Requirements]
Overall Style:
A modular infographic with clear structure and a strong modern feel, using a ‚ÄúBento Grid‚Äù layout. The background should be clean and simple, focusing on content presentation. Visually, it must show a strong hierarchical drop-off from high to low.

Level Structure and Visual Definition (Strictly enforce the following five levels):

Level 1 (Highest Level): Â§Ø (HƒÅng - Top Tier)
Research Filling Standard: According to research, the generally recognized ‚ÄúVersion King‚Äù in the field, with dominant popularity and undisputed top-tier products/works.

Visual Representation: Occupies the topmost or largest module on the screen. The color scheme is explosive burst red and glorious gold, with visual effects like halos or energy overflow. The font is the largest and boldest. The module must display the names or high-quality images of the representative products researched, accompanied by minimalist phrases of praise (e.g., ‚ÄúBlown up across the internet,‚Äù ‚ÄúMasterpiece‚Äù).

Level 2: Top Tier

Research Filling Standard: Hardcore powerhouses, whose reputation may not be as high as ‚ÄúHƒÅng,‚Äù but are highly praised and are the preferred high-quality projects for experts.

Visual Representation: Located on the second layer. The color scheme is solid, high-end burning orange and metallic silver. The module design appears robust and textured. Display representative powerhouse products.

Level 3: Superior

Research Filling Standard: Superior choices, tasteful, solid middle ground that is definitely worth buying/watching, representing a certain level of connoisseurship.

Visual Representation: Located in the middle layer. The color scheme is bright, clean lemon yellow and cool gray. The design style is modern and refreshing. Display representative high-quality middle-class products.

Level 4: NPC

Research Filling Standard: Generic products with no memory points, mass-produced industrial products, neither good nor bad, easily forgotten. Must include specific product or brand names, do not be vague.

Visual Representation: Located in the lower-middle layer. The color scheme is dull and bland bread color/beige or cardboard brown. The module design appears ordinary, repetitive, and lacks personality. Display those very mediocre products.

Level 5 (Bottom Level): ÊãâÂÆå‰∫Ü (LƒÅ - Failed)

Research Filling Standard: Recognized ‚Äúlandmines,‚Äù ‚ÄúIQ taxes,‚Äù disastrous failed products found in the research, or even products that are worse than nothing. Must include specific product or brand names, do not be vague.

Visual Representation: Squeezed into the bottom or corner of the screen, with compressed visual space. The color scheme is desperate black, pale white, and features obvious digital glitch, fragmentation, or decay visual effects. Display those famous ‚Äúflop‚Äù products, accompanied by warning phrases (e.g., ‚ÄúRun away,‚Äù ‚ÄúBig sucker‚Äù).
title: HƒÅng to LƒÅ (Good to Bad) Rating Infographic Prompt
description: A complex Chinese prompt for Nano Banana Pro designed to generate a 'HƒÅng to LƒÅ' (Good to Bad) rating infographic using a Bento Grid layout. It instructs the AI to research a user-specified topic (e.g., 2025 Chinese New Energy Vehicles) and visually categorize the results into five distinct levels, from 'HƒÅng' (Top Tier, explosive red/gold) to 'LƒÅ' (Worst Tier, desperate black/white with glitch effects), requiring specific product names for the lower tiers.

content:
You are a **photo essayist and graphic designer who records lifestyle**. Based on the input text (and attached image) provided at the end, please generate a **‚Äúmulti-cut scrapbook-style image that captures the memory of a fun meal.‚Äù**

At that time, please include the character from the attached reference image, positioned as **‚Äústickers or cut-out photos that accent the album,‚Äù** and assign them a **role (such as posing as if saying 'Itadakimasu' or commenting in a corner)**.

‚ñº Instructions for the Generation Process (Thinking Process)
Utilize Nano Banana Pro's reasoning ability and execute the following thought process before drawing:

1.  **[Step 1: Scene Expansion and Diversification]**: Imagine (simulate) multiple cuts that convey a story from the single input image of the ‚Äúpot of food.‚Äù
    * Cut A (Main): The finished dish served in a stylish bowl.
    * Cut B (Sub): A close-up of fresh ingredients (e.g., the freshness of vegetables).
    * Cut C (Sub): A close-up shot showing steam/sizzle, or the moment a spoon scoops the food.
2.  **[Step 2: Album Composition Design]**: Set the background to a ‚Äúwooden table‚Äù or ‚Äúkraft paper,‚Äù and arrange the 3-4 photos above randomly and balanced in a Polaroid or bordered photo style.
3.  **[Step 3: Decoration and Handwritten Text]**: Place masking tape, clips, and handwritten-style Japanese comments (‚ÄúGreat!‚Äù, ‚ÄúDelicious,‚Äù etc.) and a date around the photos to complete a DIY-style album.

‚ñº Design and Style Specification
* **Composition/Layout**: **Collage/Multi-panel format**. A busy composition viewed from directly above (flat lay), with multiple photos overlapping.
* **Aesthetic**: Warm, ‚Äúfilm camera‚Äù texture. A nostalgic tone with slightly desaturated colors.
* **Text**:
    * Draw the dish name and **date (e.g., {argument name="Date" default="2025.12.07"})** in a **handwritten-style font** in the margin or label area below the photo.
    * Decorative text like ‚ÄúYummy!‚Äù or ‚ÄúRecipe Memo‚Äù next to the photos.
* **Character**: Process the reference character into a ‚Äústicker style‚Äù or ‚Äúphoto cut-out style‚Äù and depict them as if they are pasted onto the album page.

‚ñº Input Text
(Enter a brief description of the ‚Äúcontents of the pot‚Äù here. Example: ‚ÄúSeafood hot pot I ate with friends,‚Äù ‚ÄúTomato stew I made on the weekend,‚Äù etc.)
{argument name="Dish" default="Chicken Paitan Hot Pot"}

content:
You are a skilled "Graphic Recorder" who structures real-time discussions and complex text information into intuitive visuals and text on the spot. Deeply understand and analyze the content of the input text provided at the end, and summarize its key points and structure into a single image in a "Graphic Recording" style, combining hand-drawn illustrations, icons, and handwritten text.

‚ñº Instructions for Generation Process (Thinking Process)
Utilize Nano Banana Pro's "Thought Model" reasoning capabilities to execute the following logical process before drawing:

1.  **Structure Extraction and Summarization**: Identify the central theme, major topics (3-5 points), and their relationships (causality, opposition, sequence, etc.) from the input text and summarize them.
2.  **Visualization and Metaphor Selection**: Determine friendly, hand-drawn icons and metaphors that symbolize each topic (e.g., growth = sprout, challenge = wall, idea = light bulb).
3.  **Layout and Gaze Guidance**: Design the arrangement on the simulated paper or whiteboard so that information flows naturally from left to right or top to bottom. Plan to use arrows and borders to logically guide the viewer's gaze.

‚ñº Design and Style Specification
**Overall Atmosphere**:
* **Medium**: An analog texture drawn on large paper or a whiteboard. Express the texture of the paper fibers and the streaking of the marker.
* **Touch**: A warm, hand-drawn style using water-based markers or colored pencils, typical of a professional facilitator. Lines should not be perfectly straight but have a human-like wobble.

**Text Representation (Crucial)**:
* **All Handwritten**: All text, including titles, headings, body text, and supplementary comments, must be drawn using a "handwritten Japanese font." Do not use any printed fonts.
* **Emphasis and Hierarchy**: Clearly define the information hierarchy by varying the size and thickness of the text; for example, writing important keywords large with a bold marker and supplementary information small with a thin pen.

**Color Scheme**:
* **Limited Palette**: Primarily black and gray line art. Use 2-3 colors from a marker set (such as warm yellow, calm blue, and accent red) as emphasis colors to prevent visual clutter.
title: Graphic Recording (GraReco) Prompt for Nano Banana Pro
description: A detailed system prompt instructing Nano Banana Pro to act as a skilled 'Graphic Recorder' (GraReco). It analyzes complex text input, extracts key themes, and visualizes them using a warm, hand-drawn style on a simulated whiteboard or large paper. The prompt strictly mandates the use of hand-drawn Japanese fonts for all text, limited color palettes (like marker sets), and logical layout design to guide the viewer's eye.

content:
Present a clear, side miniature 3D cartoon view of the tallest buildings in {argument name="city in English" default="YOUR CITY"}. Use minimal textures with realistic materials and soft, lifelike lighting and shadows. Use a clean, minimalistic composition showing exactly the three tallest buildings in {argument name="reference city in English" default="Sopot"}, arranged from left to right in strict descending height order. The tallest must appear visibly tallest, the second must be clearly shorter than the first, and the third must be clearly shorter than the second.
All buildings must follow accurate relative proportions: if a building is taller in real life, it must be taller in the image by the same approximate ratio. No building may be visually stretched or compressed.
Each building should stand separately on a thin, simple ceramic base. Below each base, centered text should display:
Height in meters ‚Äî semibold sans-serif, medium size
Year built ‚Äî lighter-weight sans-serif, smaller size, directly beneath the height text
Provide consistent padding, spacing, leading, and kerning. Write ‚Äú{argument name="city name title" default="YOUR CITY NAME"}‚Äù centered above the buildings, using a medium-sized sans-serif font.
No building top should overlap or touch the text above. Use accurate architectural proportions based on real-world references. Maintain a consistent camera angle and identical scale for each building model.
No forced perspective. Use straight-on orthographic-style rendering. Do not exaggerate or stylize size differences beyond proportional accuracy.

Use a square 1080√ó1080 composition. Use a clean, neutral background. Ensure no extra objects are present.
title: City tallest buildings 3D cartoon showcase prompt
description: A detailed prompt for generating a square 3D cartoon-style image of the three tallest buildings in a chosen city, with accurate proportions, labels for height and year, and clean typographic layout.

content:
[Instruction: Based on the structured description below, generate an authentic documentary photography image.]

Visual style: mid-20th-century war news photojournalism (1940‚Äì1970) ‚Äì raw and unposed.

1. Core subject (specific micro narrative)
{argument name="core scene" default="a mud-covered medic in a rainy trench bandaging a soldier‚Äôs arm, looking exhausted, with barbed wire obscuring the foreground"}

2. Aesthetic characteristics (anti-cinematic approach)
Photography style definition:
This must not look like a carefully lit movie still. It has to look like a raw, even slightly blurry moment, snapped by a war photographer under extreme pressure and danger. The composition should feel accidental, chaotic, slightly off-balance or imperfect. Prioritize absolute authenticity over perfect framing.

Light and atmosphere:
Avoid overly dramatic, theatrical, perfectly staged lighting. Use whatever light is available on site (usually bad): flat and oppressive overcast diffuse light, dim flickering indoor light, or harsh direct flash creating hard, ugly shadows. The atmosphere should feel gritty, dirty, and suffocatingly immersive.

3. Physical texture (film realism)
Physical properties:
Simulate high-speed, coarse-grain black-and-white film that has been push-processed.
* Focus and blur: because of the chaotic, tense environment, the main subject may be slightly out of focus, soft, or shaken. Moving people or objects must show obvious motion blur to reflect the forced use of slow shutter speeds.
* Grain: the whole image is covered with heavy, organic silver halide film grain. Avoid artificial scratches or frame borders added in post; focus on the rough materiality of the film itself.

4. Technical constraints
* Color mode: monochrome black and white.
* Lens language: 35mm wide-angle prime lens (classic reportage perspective including more environmental information).
* Period accuracy: strictly consistent with the 1940s‚Äì1970s timeline (clothing, weapons, environmental details).
title: Mid-20th-century war photojournalism style framework
description: A Chinese prompt framework for generating gritty, realistic mid-20th-century war photojournalism style images that feel like candid shots taken under pressure, with emphasis on authenticity over cinematic perfection.

content:
You are an expert-level UI/UX presentation designer. Generate high-fidelity, futuristic 16:9 presentation slides. Based on visual balance aesthetics, automatically choose the most perfect composition among a cover, grid layout, or data visualization.

For the global visual language, the style should seamlessly blend Apple Keynote minimalism, modern SaaS product design, and glassmorphism. The overall mood should feel premium, immersive, clean, and breathable. Use cinematic volumetric lighting, soft ray-traced reflections, and ambient occlusion. For the color scheme, choose either deep void black or pure ceramic white as the base, accented with flowing aurora gradients such as neon purple, electric blue, soft coral orange, and cyan for the background and UI highlights.

For the content modules on each slide, intelligently integrate the following elements:

1. Use a bento grid system as the layout engine, organizing content inside modular rounded-rectangle containers. The containers must be frosted glass with blur, featuring delicate white edges and soft shadows, and strictly preserve generous internal whitespace to avoid crowding.

2. Insert gift-like 3D objects, rendering unique, high-end abstract 3D artifacts as visual anchors. They should look like tangible, expensive gifts or collectibles, with materials such as polished metal, iridescent acrylic, transparent glass, or soft silicone, and shapes like floating capsules, spheres, shields, M√∂bius strips, or fluid waves.

3. For typography and data, use clean sans-serif fonts with high contrast. If there are charts, use glowing 3D donut charts, capsule-shaped progress bars, or floating numbers; the charts should look like glowing neon toys.

Composition logic reference: If generating a cover, place a huge, complex 3D glass object in the center with bold large text over it and aurora waves stretching in the background. If generating a content slide, use the bento grid layout with 3D icons on small cards and text on large cards. If generating a data slide, use a split-screen design: typography on the left, and a large, glowing 3D data visualization chart floating on the right.

Rendering quality requirements: Unreal Engine 5 rendering, 8K resolution, ultra-detailed textures, strong UI design sense, UX interface, Dribbble trending style, award-winning design quality.
title: Glassmorphism SaaS-style PPT design prompt for Nano Banana Pro
description: A comprehensive UI/UX presentation design prompt that lets Nano Banana Pro generate 16:9 slides in a futuristic glass card style, combining Apple Keynote minimalism and modern SaaS aesthetics.

content:
Based on the following article, create a professional Chinese PPT for me.
First write a PPT outline and plan the content of each slide.
Then feed the content of each slide to Nano Banana Pro to generate the corresponding PPT page, ensuring a consistent style.

The specific PPT style should be an ‚ÄúAnthropic/Claude-style‚Äù warm academic humanistic design.
Background: use warm beige/cream (#F3F0E9) as a solid base color, with a slightly premium paper texture.
Fonts: use an elegant serif font for titles and a modern sans-serif font for body text.
Color palette: the main colors are terracotta red (#D67052) and mustard yellow (#F0B857), accented with deep navy blue. Avoid neon colors or pure black.
Visual elements: use a grid layout that emphasizes typography. Illustration style should be abstract, organic black hand-drawn line art placed on solid terracotta red blocks. You must use illustrations and decorative elements very sparingly, and they should serve the content.
Charts: flat and minimal charts that emphasize data comparison, removing unnecessary borders.

Both text and images are generated by Nano Banana Pro. Also, do not turn the PPT into one single large image; it should be one image per slide.

The article content is:

content:
Generate a single photorealistic 16:9 image and split its composition into left and right halves. On each side, depict the same place,
[LOCATION_NAME: {argument name="location_name_en" default="(any location)"}],
at different eras.

Left side: {argument name="left_year_en" default="(any year)"} ¬∑ {argument name="left_time_en" default="(time)"}
Right side: {argument name="right_year_en" default="(any year)"} ¬∑ {argument name="right_time_en" default="(time)"}

Keep the camera position exactly the same and use the following coordinates:
[LATITUDE,LONGITUDE: {argument name="coordinates_en" default="(latitude and longitude of any place)"}]

Do not include any text in the image (years, labels, watermarks, etc.). Do not specify detailed visuals.
Leave all aspects such as architecture, light, cars, people, signs, materials, atmosphere, and composition up to Nano Banana Pro.

Each era should feel natural and together form a side-by-side time comparison image within a single 16:9 frame.
--ar 16:9 --stylize 800 --v 6

content:
Create a hand-drawn style infographic card in a 9:16 vertical ratio. The card should have a clear theme, with a beige or off‚Äëwhite paper-textured background and an overall rustic, friendly hand-drawn aesthetic.

At the top of the card, highlight the title in large brush-style cursive Chinese characters using a striking red-and-black contrast to draw the viewer‚Äôs eye. All text should be in Chinese cursive script. The layout is divided into 2 to 4 clear sections, each using short, concise Chinese phrases to express the key points. The font should maintain the flowing rhythm of cursive script while staying readable and artistic.

Add simple, fun hand-drawn illustrations or icons on the card, such as characters or symbolic motifs, to enhance visual appeal and spark reflection and empathy. Maintain visual balance in the overall layout and leave enough white space so the design remains clean, easy to read, and easy to understand.

The theme is: ‚Äú{argument name="theme" default="Building a personal IP is a long-term compounding process; if you keep showing up daily and continue consistently, you will definitely see results, because 99% of people can‚Äôt stick with it."}‚Äù
title: Hand-drawn infographic card about long-term IP building
